big.process1D.filter
Class CausalBinomial

java.lang.Object

public class CausalBinomial
extends CausalFIRFilter

This class encapsulates causal binomial-filtering operations on one-dimensional data.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

CausalBinomial

public CausalBinomial(DataBoundary boundaryExtension,
                      int order,
                      boolean normalized)
This constructor builds a convolver that performs a causal binomial-filter operation with the provided boundary extension and nonnegative order of the filter. Mathematically, the operation can be described by
∀k0 ∈ ℤ: y[k0] = 2λ L ∑k ∈ [0…L] Binomial(L, k) x[k0 - k],
where y is the result of applying the binomial operator of nonnegative order L to the data x, and where λ = 0 corresponds to a non-normalized filter and λ = -1 to a normalized one, in which case the filter with causal impulse response h is such that ∑k ∈ [0…L] h[k] = 1. The impulse responses of the first few non-normalized filters are
OrderFilter
-3invalid
-2invalid
-1invalid
0{1}
1{1, 1}
2{1, 2, 1}
3{1, 3, 3, 1}
4{1, 4, 6, 4, 1}
5{1, 5, 10, 10, 5, 1}

Parameters:
boundaryExtension - how the data is extended.
order - the order of the binomial operator.
normalized - set to true to construct a unit-gain smoothing filter; set to false to construct a filter with integer-valued coefficients
See Also:
DataBoundary
Method Detail

isNormalized

public boolean isNormalized()
This method returns true when this filter is in normalized form, false otherwise.
